concepts.label: CCRA.R.1
concepts.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.2
concepts.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.3
concepts.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.4
concepts.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.5
concepts.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.6
concepts.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.7
concepts.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.8
concepts.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.9
concepts.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

concepts.label: CCRA.R.10
concepts.description: 10. Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

concepts.label: RL.K.1
concepts.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

concepts.label: RL.K.2
concepts.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

concepts.label: RL.K.3
concepts.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

concepts.label: RL.K.4
concepts.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

concepts.label: RL.K.5
concepts.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

concepts.label: RL.K.6
concepts.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

concepts.label: RL.K.7
concepts.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

concepts.label: (Not applicable to literature)
concepts.description: (Not applicable to literature)

concepts.label: RL.K.9
concepts.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

concepts.label: RL.K.10
concepts.description: 10. Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

concepts.label: RI.K.1
concepts.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.2
concepts.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.3
concepts.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.4
concepts.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.5
concepts.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

concepts.label: RI.K.6
concepts.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.7
concepts.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

concepts.label: RI.K.8
concepts.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

concepts.label: RI.K.9
concepts.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

concepts.label: RI.K.10
concepts.description: 10. Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

concepts.label: RF.K.1a
concepts.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

concepts.label: RF.K.1b
concepts.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

concepts.label: RF.K.1c
concepts.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

concepts.label: RF.K.1d
concepts.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

concepts.label: RF.K.2a
concepts.description: Recognize and produce rhyming words.

concepts.label: RF.K.2b
concepts.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

concepts.label: RF.K.2c
concepts.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

concepts.label: RF.K.2d
concepts.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonent-vowel-consonent, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

concepts.label: RF.K.2e
concepts.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

concepts.label: RF.K.3a
concepts.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.

concepts.label: RF.K.3b
concepts.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

concepts.label: RF.K.3c
concepts.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

concepts.label: RF.K.3d
concepts.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

concepts.label: RF.K.4
concepts.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.1
concepts.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.2
concepts.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.3
concepts.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.4
concepts.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.5
concepts.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.6
concepts.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.7
concepts.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.8
concepts.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.9
concepts.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

concepts.label: CCRA.W.10
concepts.description: 10. Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

concepts.label: W.K.1
concepts.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is ...).

concepts.label: W.K.2
concepts.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

concepts.label: W.K.3
concepts.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

concepts.label: (Begins in grade 3)
concepts.description: (Begins in grade 3)

concepts.label: W.K.5
concepts.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

concepts.label: W.K.6
concepts.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

concepts.label: W.K.7
concepts.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

concepts.label: W.K.8
concepts.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

concepts.label: (Begins in grade 4)
concepts.description: (Begins in grade 4)

concepts.label: 10. (Begins in grade 3)
concepts.description: 10. (Begins in grade 3)

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.1
concepts.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.2
concepts.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.3
concepts.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.4
concepts.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.5
concepts.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

concepts.label: CCRA.SL.6
concepts.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

concepts.label: SL.K.1a
concepts.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

concepts.label: SL.K.1b
concepts.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

concepts.label: SL.K.2
concepts.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

concepts.label: SL.K.3
concepts.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

concepts.label: SL.K.4
concepts.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

concepts.label: SL.K.5
concepts.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

concepts.label: SL.K.6
concepts.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.1
concepts.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.2
concepts.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.3
concepts.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.4
concepts.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.5
concepts.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

concepts.label: CCRA.L.6
concepts.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

concepts.label: L.K.1a
concepts.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

concepts.label: L.K.1b
concepts.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

concepts.label: L.K.1c
concepts.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

concepts.label: L.K.1d
concepts.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

concepts.label: L.K.1e
concepts.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

concepts.label: L.K.1f
concepts.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

concepts.label: L.K.2a
concepts.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

concepts.label: L.K.2b
concepts.description: Recognize and name end punctuation.

concepts.label: L.K.2c
concepts.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

concepts.label: L.K.2d
concepts.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

concepts.label: (Begins in grade 2)
concepts.description: (Begins in grade 2)

concepts.label: L.K.4a
concepts.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

concepts.label: L.K.4b
concepts.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

concepts.label: L.K.5a
concepts.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

concepts.label: L.K.5b
concepts.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

concepts.label: L.K.5c
concepts.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

concepts.label: L.K.5d
concepts.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

concepts.label: L.K.6
concepts.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.
